member.name: T:Open.Text.EnumValue
member.summary: Fast utilties and extensions for parsing enums and retreiving the name of an enum value.

member.name: M:Open.Text.EnumValue.Parse``1(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.returns: The enum that represents the string provided.

member.name: M:Open.Text.EnumValue.TryParse``1(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.Boolean,``0@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of the name of one or more enumerated constants to an equivalent enumerated object.
member.param: The string representing the enum value to search for.
If true, will ignore case differences when looking for a match.
The enum that represents the string provided.
member.returns: true if the value was found; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Open.Text.EnumValue.GetName``1(``0)
member.summary: Uses an expression tree to do an fast lookup the name of the enum value.
member.remarks: Is faster than calling .ToString() on a value.
member.param: The enum value to get the name for.
member.returns: The name of the enum.

member.summary: Finds the last instance of a pattern and returns a StringSegment for subsequent use.
member.remarks: If the pattern is right-to-left, then it will return the last segment from the right (first segment from the left).

One of the enumeration values that specifies the rules for the search.
member.exception: If start index is less than zero.

member.name: M:Open.Text.TextExtensions.Slice(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a StringSegment that starts offset by the value provided and extends by the length provided.
member.param: The value (positive or negative) to move the index by.

If true, the length can exceed the segment length but not past the full length of the source string. If false (default), an ArgumentOutOfRangeException will be thrown if the expected length exeeds the segment.
